event.title: created in the old Northwest Territory in 1790

data.event: It was one of two original counties created in the old Northwest Territory in 1790 and was reduced to its present size in 1817.

event.title: was reduced to its present size in 1817

data.event: It was one of two original counties created in the old Northwest Territory in 1790 and was reduced to its present size in 1817.

event.title: 1790, Winthrop Sargent, Secretary of Northwest Territory, organized

data.event: In 1790, Winthrop Sargent, Secretary of Northwest Territory, organized the first Indiana county, Knox County.
When the Illinois Territory was formed in 1809, the portions of Knox County beyond the Wabash River became a part of Illinois.
